paragraph.heading: 1Building a .NET application
paragraph.paragraph: Eiffel for .NET has some specific functionality meant to leverage necessary aspects of the .NET Framework.

For that reason, the
../../tools/eiffelstudio/reference/25_project_settings/index.xml project settings for Eiffel for .NET introduces new options
../../tools/eiffelstudio/reference/25_project_settings/40_dotnet.xml in the .NET tab of the project settings . These options include:

list.item: Specifying whether the generated assembly should be an EXE or a DLL.
Choosing between generating verifiable or non verifiable IL code. Non verifiable IL code executes faster but requires high trust settings.

paragraph.paragraph:
The Eiffel for .NET compiler generates a single assembly whose name is the name of the system as given in the
../../tools/eiffelstudio/reference/25_project_settings/10_general.xml project settings .
